sentence: I have been experiencing at least once a week this dull pain around and mostly at the center of the chest since about 6 - 8 months.
When it began I also experienced fast heart beats during nights.
Few times I observed this pain on the back.
I have the shakes and sweats with this and a horrible jelly like mucus that I cough up.
I do not go dizzy or lightheaded.
Recently I visited an immediate care facility due to heavy wheezing and 15% lung capacity due to severe bronchitis symptoms.
For the past three months or so, I have had chest pains on the left side of the chest.
I've been having strange chest pains for the past month or so.
I felt burning in the left side of my chest that would not go away for about ten minutes.
For the next week or so, I began to have chest pains and also pain in my upper arms.
I have also had pain in the forearms, at the elbow joints, and throbbing or numbness in the hands.
After about a week of this, I laid down to go to sleep one night and had chest pains and shooting pains in my left upper arm.
She's had chest pain (occational pressure too) in her chest that increases in severity when she breathes.
I have a stabbing pain under both ribs, the classic costo pain on my sternum.
I was sleeping and suddenly I felt that I am out of breath and not getting enough air in my lungs.
After six months or so again, I had the similar attack early in the morning, with chest tightness and breathing difficulty.
After three four months again I had the similar attack and this attack lasted few day with chest tightness and excessive difficulty in breathing.
In late November I started to get a pain in the right side of my chest just below my rib cage.
I was short of breath and could only sleep on one side of my body.
Sharp pains while breathing and shortness of breath continued.
I have had trouble with my throat swelling, it shuts sometimes when eating and I can not even swollow liquids.
I sometimes get the feeling that I can't catch my breath and have to yawn or stretch to get a deep, filling breath.
My other symptoms are headaches, earaches, sneezing, occasional cough (can't get the mucus to come up), post nasal drip and recently I've been getting dizzy when I lie down.
I also get palpitations that seem to be getting worse lately.
I have had a cough that is getting worse everyday.
Recently 2 weeks back I got right side upper chest pain and inflammation.
I have experienced random, sharp chest pains that seem to come from the left side of my chest.
I experienced left shoulder pain along with pain under my sternum.
I have had a sharp pain in my right rib cage area, in the back.
In the last two months I have started coughing blood first in the morning.
I have had a weird cough for about 2 months now, more of a dry hack, a single cough, caused by a constant tickle in the back of my throat.
I do have a bit of a tight throat.
At the end of September I've started to experience pain in the left side of the chest around heart.
My lungs felt kind of heavy and I've started to cough out white mucus.
I am feeling tightness or discomfort in my chest when I breath.
I have been getting more and more sharp pain in my chest, generally in the left side of my chest, over the last few months.
A few weeks ago I was rushed into hospital with severe pains in chest and in the back and vomiting.
Yesterday I had an extreme bad nosebleed.
I feel like I am being choked inside throat.
I was watching television and all of a sudden I had a sharp jolting pain in my upper left part of my chest.
This time it was followed by dizziness, sweating, nausea, tingling hands and anxiety.
I've had a pain in my right chest since last April.
I started to get a pain in my lower right abdomen.
I am having a lot of tightness in the chest in area over my heart.
About a month ago I noticed that my neck was abnormally stiff and my lung capacity seemed reduced somewhat.
My neck seemed somewhat swollen mostly on the lower right side though the left side may have been a little swollen to.
I was having some mild pain behind my ears and in my jaw.
Oddly enough, though I don't think it was related, my left top eyelid was twitching uncontrollably for 2 weeks leading up to me going to the doctor.
However, I had no other symptoms like a sore throat or cough that would suggest a cold.
I only have occassional ear pain.
I'm still having discomfort that won't go away in my left chest area.
